channel.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
channel.description:
After seeing some ep3 Speculations in many places (including here) I also found another video game which is heavily wanted by fans, with little development news: Star wars Battlefront 3
To start, here's a good site on BF3's info [url='https://www.battlefront3.net/']https://www.battlefront3.net/[/url]
Started on Pandemic developing the game (which unfortunately ea motherfuckers shut the company down) then handed over to free radical games (which is also shut down and brought by crytek to be crytek uk) then leads to Rebellion (which just developed a lame psp battlefront game) and leads us to here, the present. Currently, after FU2 (Force unleashed 2) which is very disappointing, Lego SW3:the clone wars, the old republic, and the shit no battlefront at e3 2011, that leaves us with 3 chances of announcement this year : 1. ComiCon 2011 2. May 4th, star wars day, they say "all will be revealed" that day ( although probably just the bluray movies, but what's the point of announcing something that is already announced to be released at September or sumthin') 3. VGA 2011 (FU2 was announced at VGA) Or wait again next year, and the year after that....
One can only hope, may the force be with you battlefront 3!

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
Yeah, I remember someone took the Red Carbonite chamber from Empire Strikes Back, and added Vader and Luke models. I remember joining with someone and being all like,

"[COLOR=‘Red’]The force is with you, young Skywalker, but you are not a Jedi yet… "

P.S. It’s funny that the link I posted of Jedi Knight shows the camera having that tilt motion that Black Mesa is going to have.

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: Flubly
item.description:
What really made Jedi Knight incredible was its online community in the MSN Zone. The modding being distributed through massassi.net with plenty of creative modders and players made for the most unique FPS community I’ve ever been apart of.

It makes gaming communities now feel more restrictive and self-important. It was amazing to have a game that was really shaped by the hands of the community itself, not through their feedback.

I think my JK folder was over 3 gb, when the game is not even 900 megs. So many levels and mods, and they were all used regularly.

/nostalgia

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: Shinobi
item.description:
Ibanez:

Bro fist. Jedi Knight was my shit. I even tried recreating it in Jedi Academy (quake 3 engine) a few years ago. Got like 3-4 levels done. Links to what I made here and here.

It was looking pretty good there. Would have been an awesome remake since I could never really get into the JK series.

Read full topic

item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

Yeah, it’s too much flash and not enough spirit.

How could I forget to mention the GREATEST Star Wars game of all time?!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JoVY4SOCjiA

Bro fist. Jedi Knight was my shit. I even tried recreating it in Jedi Academy (quake 3 engine) a few years ago. Got like 3-4 levels done. Links to what I made here and here.

item.description:
KOTOR 2 was better than KOTOR for me while it lasted, but it still didn’t feel complete by the end. Liked them pretty equally though.

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: Shinobi
item.description:
loony636:

Woah wait, what? Even with the shitty bugs and incomplete story, I honestly felt KotOR II had a better story, deeper characters and more involvement than KotOR I. In any case, they are at least on par.

Totally agree. Also Star Wars: Yoda Stories: BEST STAR WARS GAME EVER. HECK YEAH

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
garthbartin:

Doesn’t quite beat MW3 though, that’ll be too amazing to even compare it to other games.

Except MW 1 and 2? God, they were just too excellent for words. /dripping sarcasm

jethrosoup:

KotOR is amazing. Forgetting that Dragon Age exists for a moment, BioWare can pretty much do no wrong.

KotOR II, on the other hand, is a fucking disgrace to its predecessor.

Woah wait, what? Even with the shitty bugs and incomplete story, I honestly felt KotOR II had a better story, deeper characters and more involvement than KotOR I. In any case, they are at least on par.

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
Someonerandm:

But thats not Republic Commando. I don’t understand…

I wouldn’t say it’s better than Republic Commando, but it was very good for an old FPS and has a more memorable place in my heart as far as Star Wars goes.

I, personally, think that it is the only game that captures the mood of the original series and doesn’t add anything that reminds me of the prequels.

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
KotOR is amazing. Forgetting that Dragon Age exists for a moment, BioWare can pretty much do no wrong.

KotOR II, on the other hand, is a fucking disgrace to its predecessor.

On topic, Battlefront 3 is a much welcome addition to the Battlefront world in my opinion. Battlefront is one of my favorite all-time games, and while II wasn’t bad, it didn’t feel like much more than a map/class pack to me (although the addition of space battles was amazing).

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: That_One
item.description:
As put by Yahtzee “Putting the label Star Wars actually reduces sales…”
I think George Lucas is just grinding more money out of fanboys, and I KNOW that is not the first time someone said that.

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: Shinobi
item.description:
Mont_Blanc:

Galactic Battlegrounds is a must have for all SW fans and RTS gamers but it still can’t beat SW Rebellion

Oh man I am totally reinstalling that now.

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Battlefront 3 Speculations
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

Yeah, Republic Commando was the fucking shit. I have the little team of 4 as action figures on my PC table right here - obviously among other collectibles.

Battlefront was fun because it was very well dressed in the competitive sense. Space battles rocked, classes were awesome, and nothing beats multiplayer.

I think it’s worth mentioning that their was a fantastic Star Wars RTS: Star Wars Galactic Battlegrounds.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G_GTqShCqR8&feature=related

It’s not too flashy, but it’s got all the imperial walkers and battle droids to make everyone happy.

Also, I must mention that out of all RTSs that I have played, this game has some of the greatest base management and economy collecting in any game that I have played.

I remember that game, it was pretty fun. Although it played a lot like Age of Empires iirc.

Read full topic
